Convert the type of a matrix

Source: R/matrix.R
convert_matrix_type.Rd

Convert the type of a matrix

Usage

convert_matrix_type(matrix, type = c("uint32_t", "double", "float"))

Arguments

matrix

IterableMatrix object input

type

One of uint32_t (unsigned 32-bit integer), float (32-bit real number), or double (64-bit real number)

Value

IterableMatrix object

Examples

mat <- matrix(rnorm(50), nrow = 10, ncol = 5)
rownames(mat) <- paste0("gene", seq_len(10))
colnames(mat) <- paste0("cell", seq_len(5))
mat <- mat %>% as("dgCMatrix") %>% as("IterableMatrix")
#> Error in mat %>% as("dgCMatrix") %>% as("IterableMatrix"): could not find function "%>%"
mat
#>             cell1      cell2      cell3      cell4      cell5
#> gene1   0.7551251 -0.6912054 -0.6675648 -0.2327618  0.7478688
#> gene2   0.3424035  1.3398599  1.3895059  0.6374729  3.3915088

#> gene6   0.7376294 -0.7160587 -0.7893881 -0.6832669 -0.8053435

#> gene10  0.1943924 -0.4321952  0.6763896 -1.2778199  2.1327019
convert_matrix_type(mat, "float")
